result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Teondre D Brazil

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Violation Report 10.10.22

Defendant Teondre D Brazil in court.  Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court for Teondre D Brazil.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status conference.  Defense requests final pretrial and jury trial dates be set.  Co-Defendant case 22CF239 is proceeding separately.  Court sets 1/10/2023 deadline for filing of Motions in Limine, Witness lists and Jury instructions.  Case adjourned to Br. 16.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Teondre D Brazil in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Teondre D Brazil appeared by video means with Attorney. Defense has all discovery and is requesting trial dates. Court sets case for a status conference to track co-defendant case. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Teondre D Brazil in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Discussion with parties regarding discovery issues. Court adjourns matter for an additional Status Conference date, due to reasons put forth on the record. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-28-2022

OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Teondre D Brazil in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials, with the exception of photo dumps. Court adjourns matter for a Status Conference date to allot additional time for the exchange of discovery. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-24-2022

Defendant Teondre D Brazil in court with Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson; both appear by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer T. Kotnik.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 3-09-2022

Defendant Teondre D Brazil in court with Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is out ill. Defense takes no position as to an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 2-8-2022

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.
No driving without a valid license.
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for LEVEL 5 supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court.  
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Teondre D Brazil in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Teondre D Brazil
Current: 2924A N Richards Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212   (Effective: 02-01-2022)
Prior: 2612 North 38th Street #A, Milwaukee, WI 53210
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/1/22 @ 1:30p
